text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
This transmits revised IRM 2.123.1, Knowledge Management, Knowledge Management Directive.
This Directive is applicable to all organizations within Internal Revenue Service Information Technology (IRS IT) that provide service and support to IT customers.
Table of Contents
Program Scope and Objectives
Program Scope and
Background
Purpose
Scope
Authority
Mandate

) Overview - This Internal Revenue Manual (IRM) establishes uniform Informa- tion Technology (IT) Knowledge Management (KM) standards for requesting support, services and products through the Service Manager and OS Ge

er- vices tools. KM comprises a range of strategies and practices used in this organization to identify, create, represent, distribute and enable adoption of knowledge articles. This IRM is to be used by anyone who has the responsibil- ity of providing service and support to IT customers. (
) Purpose - The primary purpose of uniform KM standards is to improve effi- ciency while utilizing the Service Manager and OS Ge
ervices tools. (
) Audience - This IRM applies to all Internal Revenue Service (IRS) organiza- tions requesting or providing products and services from IT. (
) Policy Owner - Any waivers or deviations of this directive requires written approval from the Associate Chief Information Officer (ACIO), User and Network Services (UNS). (
) Program Owner - IT, UNS, Customer Service Support (CSS) is responsible the development, implementation and maintenance of this directive. (

) Primary Stakeholders - Approval of this directive, including updates, rests with the IT Chief Technology Officer (CTO) and ACIO for UNS. All proposed changes to this directive must be submitted to IT UNS CSS. (

) Program Goals - The primary objective of IT KM is to maintain the integrity of approved IT knowledge available to end-users and technicians through identiﬁ- cation, standardization, sharing, documenting, and storage of knowledge. This knowledge provides IT solutions for self-service, user education, and technical support to enhance the work environment. This IRM has been prepared in ac- cordance with requirements resulting from the IRM restructuring and IRS modernization efforts. (
) This IRM establishes uniform IT KM standards for requesting IT support, services and products through the Service Manager and OS Ge

ervices tools. KM comprises a range of strategies and practices used in this organization to identify, create, represent, distribute and enable adoption of knowledge articles. This IRM is to be used by anyone who has the responsibility of providing service and support to IT customers. (

This knowledge provides IT solutions for self-service, user education, and technical support to enhance the work environment. This IRM has been prepared in accordance with requirements resulting from the IRM restructuring and IRS modernization efforts. (

Overview - This Internal Revenue Manual (IRM) establishes uniform Informa- tion Technology (IT) Knowledge Management (KM) standards for requesting IT support, services and products through the Service Manager and OS GetSer- vices tools. KM comprises a range of strategies and practices used in this organization to identify, create, represent, distribute and enable adoption of knowledge articles. This IRM is to be used by anyone who has the responsibil- ity of providing service and support to IT customers.
Purpose - The primary purpose of uniform KM standards is to improve effi- ciency while utilizing the Service Manager and OS GetServices tools.

) IT, UNS, CSS is responsible for the development, implementation and mainte- nance of this directive. Approval of this directive, including updates, rests with the IT CTO and ACIO for UNS. All proposed changes to this directive must submitted to IT UNS CSS.

) KM comprises a range of strategies and practices used in this organization identify, create, represent, distribute and enable adoption of knowledge articles. This IRM is to be used by anyone who has the responsibility of providing service and support to IT customers. (
) This IRM establishes the following: a. The primary purpose of uniform KM standards is to improve efficiency while utilizing the Service Manager and OS Ge

ervices tools. b. The KM support process is deﬁned as the organized approach to docu- menting both the process and results of IT customer support in a single database. IRS management at each site is responsible for ensuring com- pliance within these standards and to meet the Master Service Level Agreements. c. KM is an effective and powerful asset for people in all roles across all stages of the service lifecycle. The Knowledgebase in the Service Manager tool is an excellent method for individuals and teams to share data, information and knowledge about all facets of an IT Service. The KM module contains two databases, IT and Employee Resource Center (ERC). This IRM only covers providers serviced by the IT database.
The primary purpose of uniform KM standards is to improve efficiency while utilizing the Service Manager and OS Ge

ervices tools. The KM support process is deﬁned as the organized approach to docu- menting both the process and results of IT customer support in a single database. IRS management at each site is responsible for ensuring pliance within these standards and to meet the Master Service Level Agreements. KM is an effective and powerful asset for people in all roles across all stages of the service lifecycle. The Knowledgebase in the Service Manager tool is an excellent method for individuals and teams to share data, information and knowledge about all facets of an IT Service. The KM module contains two databases, IT and Employee Resource Center (ERC). This IRM only covers providers serviced by the IT database.
